meanings.sent1: The old building had a rubbly foundation.
meanings.sent2: The path was rubbly with small stones and debris.
meanings.sent3: The kids built a rubbly fort out of rocks and sticks.
meanings.sent4: Her voice sounded rubbly, like gravel underfoot.
meanings.sent5: The rubbly terrain made it difficult to walk without stumbling.

meanings.sent1: The rubbly road was hard to navigate after the storm.
meanings.sent2: The backyard was rubbly with broken bricks and concrete.
meanings.sent3: The rubbly yard looked like a construction site.
meanings.sent4: Her hands were rubbly from clearing the debris.
meanings.sent5: The rubbly ground crunched under their feet as they walked.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a rough, uneven surface.
meanings.sent1: The rubbly texture of the wall made it hard to paint.
meanings.sent2: The rubbly terrain made biking a challenge.
meanings.sent3: The rubbly fabric snagged on her sweater.
meanings.sent4: His rubbly hands felt rough against her skin.
meanings.sent5: The rubbly surface of the moon was visible through the telescope.
